title: Barbarea
text:
Barbarea (winter cress or yellow rocket) is a genus of about 22 species of <a href="flowering%20plant">flowering plant</a>s in the family <a href="Brassicaceae">Brassicaceae</a>, native to temperate regions of the <a href="Northern%20Hemisphere">Northern Hemisphere</a>, with the highest species diversity in southern <a href="Europe">Europe</a> and southwest <a href="Asia">Asia</a>. They are small herbaceous <a href="biennial%20plant">biennial</a> or <a href="perennial%20plant">perennial plant</a>s with dark green, deeply lobed <a href="leaf">leaves</a> and yellow <a href="flower">flower</a>s with four petals.
Uses.
They grow quickly into dandelion-like rosettes of edible, <a href="Lepidium%20sativum">cress</a>-like foliage. "Barbarea verna", also known as upland cress, early winter cress, American cress, Belle Isle cress and scurvy grass, is used in salads or to add a nippy taste to mixed greens for cooking.
Chemical compounds.
Winter cress contains different <a href="glucosinolates">glucosinolates</a>, <a href="flavonoids">flavonoids</a> and <a href="saponins">saponins</a>.
